items.title: Snack Wrap unwrapped: Here's why McDonald's is bringing back a fan favorite on July 10
items.description: If McDonald’s ever doubted it needed to bring back the Snack Wrap, consider this: Nine years after the fast-food powerhouse discontinued the item in the U.S., customers have continued to order it at drive-thrus.  On Tuesday, McDonald's announced that a new version of the Snack Wrap will go on sale July 10.  McDonald's invented the Snack Wrap — a tortilla full of chicken, lettuce, shredded cheese and sauce — almost two decades ago to make it easier to eat its chicken on the go.

items.title: Subway-owner Roark Capital buys Dave's Hot Chicken for $1 billion with rapid expansion plans underway
items.description: Restaurant chain Dave's Hot Chicken is now owned by the same private equity firm that is behind Subway and Dunkin'.

items.title: Airbnb Would Be A Check-In, Save For Economic Concerns And Regulatory Headwinds
items.description: Airbnb's strong balance sheet, diversification, and long-term rental focus make it attractive.

items.title: McDonald's Defensive Positioning And Future Drivers
items.description: Discover why McDonald's stands out as a defensive play amid market headwinds. Learn about its growth drivers and why now might be a good time to invest.

items.title: McDonald’s removes Chicken Bacon Caesar Wrap from menu
items.description: The wrap, which featured chicken breast strips, onions, Caesar-style sauce, bacon and lettuce, was initially introduced in 2023.
